N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 174.5 - Computation of the direct cost of educational services provided to homeless children pursuant to section 3202(8) of the education law and section 100.2(x) of this title

State Regulations

For purposes of reimbursement pursuant to section
3202
(a)(8)
of the Education Law, the direct costs
of educational services provided to a homeless child for whom the school
district of current location, as defined in section
100.2
(x)(1)(iii)
of this Title, or a school district participating in an approved regional
placement plan is designated as the district of attendance shall be calculated
in accordance with this section. (a) The direct cost of educational services provided by such a school district for
each such homeless child attending upon instruction for the school year shall
be computed as follows: (1)

The cost of
instruction of pupils in each category of pupils, computed in accordance with
section
174.2
(a)(1)-(2)
of
this Part, shall be divided by the estimated average daily attendance of pupils
in each category, including the estimated full-time equivalent attendance of
those children attending upon instruction pursuant to section
3202 (5) and
(8)
of the Education Law. (2)

Such direct cost of educational services
shall upon the conclusion of the school year be audited against actual
revenues, expenditures and average daily attendance, including the actual
full-time equivalent attendance of those children attending upon instruction
pursuant to section
3202 (5) and
(8)
of the Education Law. (b) The direct cost of educational
services provided by such a school district for each such homeless child
attending upon instruction for less than the school year shall be computed by
multiplying the direct cost of educational services as computed in subdivision
(a) of this section by the full-time equivalent attendance of such child as
computed pursuant to section
175.6
of this Title. Notes
